content.question: An elevator has a posted weight limit of <math alttext="4,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds and an occupancy limit of <math alttext="21" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> people. If the weights of adult males are approximately normally distributed with <math alttext="mu equals 190" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>190</mn></math> pounds and <math alttext="sigma equals 32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></math> pounds, which of the following best approximates the probability that a random sample of <math alttext="21" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> adult males will exceed the posted weight limit of the elevator?
